m_szDocSumamry: Agricultural Waste Can Clean up Nuclear Waste, Researchers Find September 18th, 2009 by Susan Kraemer Â  Waste uranium can apparently be recovered very cheaply from the polluted runoff from uranium mining using E. Coli and a phosphate storage molecule found in seeds, British researchers have found. They used the common bacteria with a chemical parallel of what is already found in agricultural waste: inositol phosphate. Inositol phosphate is insoluble, so it forms a precipitate on the bacteria.
